title: Bitcoin Falls to Late-2020 Levels Amid Crypto Selloff
sub_head: Monetary-policy concerns roil both crypto assets and traditional markets
body:
HONG KONG—This year’s rout in bitcoin deepened, with the world’s biggest cryptocurrency dropping below $25,000 amid a broader selloff fanned by concerns about rising U.S. interest rates.
Digital currencies fell on Monday in Asia, after a fresh inflation shock heightened investors’ fears that the Federal Reserve could be forced to act more aggressively to tame surging prices.
